psl.memento.pervasive.crunch2
Class Crunch2Settings

java.lang.Object
  psl.memento.pervasive.crunch2.Crunch2Settings
public class Crunch2Settings
extends Object

Handles all the arguments and settings for Crunch2.

Author:
Peter Grimm ( pmg23@psl.cs.columbia.edu )

Constructor Detail

Crunch2Settings

public Crunch2Settings(String[] args)
Constructs a new Crunch2Settings using a given set of arguments. Usually the arguments given will be from the main function.

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments to be parsed.
Method Detail

initialize

private void initialize()
Reads in all command line arguments.

loadSettings

private void loadSettings()

processArgument

private int processArgument(int argNumber)
Takes a given argument represented by its respective number in the array of arguments and figures out what to do with it. The number of arguments parsed including the current one is returned so the loop can restart at the next intelligent argument.

Parameters:
argNumber - The number of the argument to be processed with respect to the argument array.
Returns:
the number of arguments that were processed

processSocketTimeout

private void processSocketTimeout(int argNumber)
Parameters:
argNumber - the command line argument that contains the socket timeout

processServerSocketTimeout

private void processServerSocketTimeout(int argNumber)
Parameters:
argNumber - the command line argument that contains the server socket timeout

processPortArgument

private void processPortArgument(int argNumber)
Processes a port argument. Prints an error if the port was invalid or nonexistant.

Parameters:
argNumber - the argument that contains the number of the port.

Returns:

setListenPort

public void setListenPort(int i)
Sets the port to listen on in proxy mode. Valid ports are in the range from 0 to 65535.

Parameters:
i - the port to listen on in proxy mode

b - whether or not to run in proxy mode
